PhyMediumComments: black-and-white: Ansco Superpan Press safety film
CatDescriptText: Mr. Carl Mitchell, 2 Jacobus Way, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 21, 1958, pg.5 with question: "Do you think that the city needs a fair housing ordinance?" answer reads: "I think so. Right now things are very bad in reference to housing and there are not too many places where Negro people can live.  The rents are so high that one cannot get a place in which to live and the places one can get are not too good for living quarters."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Carl Mitchell wearing Yellow Cab Company jacket and hat, standing across from the Buhl Building with Fanny Farmer Candies, Fifth Avenue, Downtown
